Title: Getting Started with QR-Based Restaurant Management System API

Nodes.Text: API for browsing menu items and placing orders in a QR-based restaurant system.

The generated code uses the Newtonsoft Json.NET NuGet Package. If the automatic NuGet package restore is enabled, these dependencies will be installed automatically. Therefore, you will need internet access for build.
* Open the solution (QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.sln) file.
Invoke the build process using Ctrl + Shift + B shortcut key or using the Build menu as shown below.
The build process generates a portable class library, which can be used like a normal class library. More information on how to use can be found at the MSDN Portable Class Libraries documentation.

The supported version is **.NET Standard 2.0**. For checking compatibility of your .NET implementation with the generated library, [click here](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/platform/dotnet-standard#versions).
The following section explains how to use the QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.Standard library in a new project.
For starting a new project, right click on the current solution from the solution explorer and choose `Add -> New Project`.

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in Visual Studio

Nodes.Text: Next, choose `Console Application`, provide `TestConsoleProject` as the project name and click OK.

Nodes.AlternateText: Create a new Console Application in Visual Studio

Nodes.Text: The new console project is the entry point for the eventual execution. This requires us to set the `TestConsoleProject` as the start-up project. To do this, right-click on the `TestConsoleProject` and choose `Set as StartUp Project` form the context menu.

In order to use the `QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.Standard` library in the new project, first we must add a project reference to the `TestConsoleProject`. First, right click on the `References` node in the solution explorer and click `Add Reference...`

Next, a window will be displayed where we must set the `checkbox` on `QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.Standard` and click `OK`. By doing this, we have added a reference of the `QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.Standard` project into the new `TestConsoleProject`.

Steps.Title: Add reference of the library project

Nodes.Text: Once the `TestConsoleProject` is created, a file named `Program.cs` will be visible in the solution explorer with an empty `Main` method. This is the entry point for the execution of the entire solution. Here, you can add code to initialize the client library and acquire the instance of a Api class. Sample code to initialize the client library and using Api methods is given in the subsequent sections.
The following parameters are configurable for the API Client:

Data:
Action delegate that configures the HTTP client by using the HttpClientConfiguration.Builder for customizing API call settings.
*Default*: `new HttpClient()`
Represents the logging configuration builder for API calls
The Credentials Setter for OAuth 2 Bearer token

Nodes.Text: The API client can be initialized as follows:

This API uses the following authentication schemes.
* [`bearerAuth (OAuth 2 Bearer token)`]($h/__auth_BearerAuth)
Documentation for accessing and setting credentials for bearerAuth.

Data: The OAuth 2.0 Access Token to use for API requests.

Nodes.Text: **Note:** Auth credentials can be set using `BearerAuthCredentials` in the client builder and accessed through `BearerAuthCredentials` method in the client instance.
You must provide credentials in the client as shown in the following code snippet.
This page can contain Tutorials/Guides/Changelogs or any information that API providers want to expose to their users besides what is auto-generated by Apimatic.

* [Menu]($e/Menu)
* [Order]($e/Order)
Endpoints for browsing menu items
An instance of the `MenuApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
MenuApi menuApi = client.MenuApi;

Nodes.Title: List Menu Items
Nodes.Name: ListMenuItems
Nodes.Description: Returns the full list of menu items currently available for ordering.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `Data` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [Models.MenuResponse]($m/MenuResponse).

ReturnTypeExample.Text:
{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    },
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",
      "name": "Chicken Biryani",
      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    }
  ]
}

Response.Name: response200
Response.Description:
List of menu items

Nodes.Text: Endpoints for creating and viewing orders
An instance of the `OrderApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
OrderApi orderApi = client.OrderApi;

Nodes.Title: Place Order
Nodes.Name: PlaceOrder
Nodes.Description: Creates an order for the specified items and table.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `Data` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [Models.OrderResponse]($m/OrderResponse).

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Order payload including items, table number, and customer details.

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"POST","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/place-order{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json","Content-Type":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"json","data":{% if call["args"]["body"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["body"] | unwrap_add_props | json: false }}{% else %}null{% endif %}}}

Response.Name: response201
Response.Description:
Order placed successfully

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance.

Headers.Name: Location
Headers.Description: URL of the created order resource

Nodes.Title: Get Order History
Nodes.Name: GetOrderHistory
Nodes.Description: Returns the authenticated user's recent orders.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `Data` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [Models.OrderHistoryResponse]($m/OrderHistoryResponse).

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/history{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}

Response.Description:
List of previous orders

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance.

Nodes.Text: HttpClientConfiguration represents the current state of the Http Client.
Properties

Data: Number of times the request is retried.
Exponential backoff factor for duration between retry calls.
The time interval between the endpoint calls.
List of Http status codes to invoke retry.
List of Http request methods to invoke retry.
HttpClient instance used to make the HTTP calls
Boolean which allows the SDK to override http client instance's settings used for features like retries, timeouts etc.

Nodes.Text: Methods

Data: Creates an object of the HttpClientConfiguration using the values provided for the builder.

Nodes.Text: Class to build instances of HttpClientConfiguration.
Methods

Data: Number of times the request is retried.
Exponential backoff factor for duration between retry calls.
The time interval between the endpoint calls.
List of Http status codes to invoke retry.
List of Http request methods to invoke retry.
Configures the proxy server settings used for outbound API calls.
HttpClient instance used to make the HTTP calls
Builds a new HttpClientConfiguration object using the set fields.

Nodes.Text: The builder for logging configuration. Create instance using `LogBuilder.Build()`
Methods

Data: Sets the implementation of Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger for logging. **The default implementation is ConsoleLogger.**
Sets the Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel, which defines logging severity levels. **The default value is LogLevel.Information.**
Sets the global setting to mask sensitive HTTP headers in both requests and responses before logging, safeguarding confidential data. **The default value is True.**
Sets the request logging configuration with the provided builder action. **By default, request logging is enabled, excluding both the body and headers.**
Sets the response logging configuration with the provided builder action. **By default, response logging is enabled, excluding both the body and headers.**

Nodes.Text: Usage Example
Client Initialization with Custom Logger
To use a custom logger, you can provide any implementation of Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger directly during SDK client initialization.
The builder for request logging configuration. Create instance using `LogRequestBuilder.Build()`
Methods

Data: Sets the logging of the request body. **By default, the body is not logged.**
Sets the logging of the request headers. **By default, the headers are not logged.**
Sets the inclusion of query parameters in the logged request path. **By default, query parameters aren't included in the request path.**
Sets the headers that will exclusively be included in the log output of the request headers. **By default, all headers are included.**
Sets the headers that will be excluded in the log output of the request headers. **By default, no headers are excluded.**
Sets the headers that will be unmasked in the log output of the request headers. **By default, no headers are unmasked.**

Nodes.Text: The builder for response logging configuration. Create instance using `LogResponseBuilder.Build()`
Methods

Data: Sets the logging of the response body. **By default, the body is not logged.**
Sets the logging of the response headers. **By default, the headers are not logged.**
Sets the headers that will exclusively be included in the log output of the response headers. **By default, all headers are included.**
Sets the headers that will be excluded in the log output of the response headers. **By default, no headers are excluded.**
Sets the headers that will be unmasked in the log output of the response headers. **By default, no headers are unmasked.**

Nodes.Text: Represents the proxy server configurations for API calls. Start building by using `new ProxyConfigurationBuilder("http://your.proxy.host")`.
Builder Methods

Data: Sets the port used to connect to the proxy server. Default is `8080`.
Sets both username and password in a single method.
Enables or disables HTTP tunneling through the proxy server.

Nodes.Text: Client Initialization with Proxy Configuration
To configure the SDK to use a proxy server, initialize the proxy configuration during client setup as shown in the Usage Example.

Nodes.Text: This is the base class for all exceptions that represent an error response from the server. It inherits from [`System.Exception`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.exception).
Properties

Data: Gets the HTTP response code from the API request.
Gets or sets the HttpContext for the request and response.

Data: Returns a human-readable string representation of the `ApiException`, including the error message and status code.
